meanings.definition: A unit of spoken language consisting of a single uninterrupted sound
meanings.sent1: Each word is made up of at least one syllable.
meanings.sent2: I can hear each syllable clearly when you speak.
meanings.sent3: The baby tried to mimic the syllable 'ma' with a big smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, each syllable like a musical note.
meanings.sent5: The teacher clapped out each syllable to help the students understand.

meanings.definition: A unit of organization for a sequence of sounds in speech
meanings.sent1: The syllable 'un' is part of the word 'understand'.
meanings.sent2: In English, syllables help us break down words into smaller parts.
meanings.sent3: The syllable 'ba' was repeated over and over in the funny song.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a beautiful melody, each syllable perfectly in place.
meanings.sent5: The actor emphasized each syllable to convey the emotion of the monologue.
